title: Designing Civic Accessibility Tools
summary: Helping local governments make public services more approachable through inclusive service design.
problem: Residents with disabilities were opting out of city programs due to inaccessible digital touchpoints.
team: UX researcher, content strategist, accessibility consultant
deliverables: Research synthesis, service blueprint, interactive prototype

sections.heading: Overview
sections.body: Partnered with the City of Pune to redesign their civic benefits application flow for residents with mixed abilities.

sections.heading: Research
sections.body: Conducted contextual inquiries, accessibility audits, and diary studies across 12 residents to map friction points.

sections.heading: Insights
sections.body: Discovered that inconsistent tone and fragmented requests for documents caused anxiety and drop-off.

sections.heading: Design Process
sections.body: Prototyped a modular eligibility checker with accessible language guidelines and service handoff scripts.

sections.heading: Final Solution
sections.body: Delivered a responsive prototype with a step-by-step playbook for civic staff.

reflection: Proved that research narrativized with empathy shifts stakeholder priorities faster than metrics alone.

title: Ambient Wellness Companion
summary: An ambient interface that helps students build mindful study rituals across their dorm spaces.
problem: Scattered routines made it difficult for students to maintain balance between coursework and wellbeing.
deliverables: Experience map, motion studies, coded prototype

sections.heading: Context
sections.body: Envisioned a dorm-friendly companion that uses ambient light and gentle motion cues.

sections.heading: Research
sections.body: Shadowed students through their daily routines, mapping moments where stress spikes.

sections.heading: Insights
sections.body: Micro-celebrations and environmental cues prompted positive behavior shifts more than verbal nudges.

sections.heading: Design Process
sections.body: Iterated on haptic feedback patterns and motion studies to keep the companion delightful.

sections.heading: Final Solution
sections.body: Crafted a web-based prototype demonstrating the companion's ambient rituals.

reflection: Experimented with motion storytelling to articulate emotion across screens and physical space.

title: Designing a Research Library
summary: A digital library that translates dense research artefacts into approachable narratives for NGOs.
problem: Community partners struggled to access and reuse past research learnings.
deliverables: Information architecture, storytelling framework, high-fidelity prototype

sections.heading: Problem
sections.body: Qualitative insights were trapped in PDFs, making reuse impossible for facilitators.

sections.heading: Process
sections.body: Co-created scenario cards and guided filters with facilitators to encourage reuse.

sections.heading: Outcome
sections.body: Delivered a searchable, narrative-led library with a content reuse playbook.

reflection: Reframing research documentation as living stories improved retention across stakeholders.
